meanings.definition: A person who is the target of a practical joke or prank.
meanings.sent1: During the party, the friends planned to surprise one of them by making them the muggees of a funny prank.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends decided to make John the muggees of their April Fools' Day prank.
meanings.sent3: The muggees laughed along with everyone when they realized they were the target of the prank.
meanings.sent4: Being the muggees of the joke, they couldn't help but smile at the cleverness of their friends.
meanings.sent5: The memory of being the muggees in that prank stayed with them for years to come.

meanings.definition: The individuals who are being deceived or taken advantage of.
meanings.sent1: The scammer targeted the elderly as the muggees of his dishonest scheme.
meanings.sent2: The muggees of the scam felt betrayed when they discovered the truth.
meanings.sent3: The muggees were surprised to learn they had been tricked by the smooth-talking salesman.
meanings.sent4: Feeling like the muggees in a magic show, they couldn't believe how easily they were fooled.
meanings.sent5: The muggees vowed to be more cautious in the future to avoid falling for such tricks again.

meanings.definition: The recipients of a gift or favor.
meanings.sent1: The children eagerly awaited being the muggees of the generous donations from the community.
meanings.sent2: As the muggees of the surprise party, they were overwhelmed with gratitude.
meanings.sent3: The muggees were thrilled to receive unexpected presents from their thoughtful friends.
meanings.sent4: Like the muggees of a treasure hunt, they searched eagerly for their hidden gifts.
meanings.sent5: The smiles on the faces of the muggees showed how much they appreciated the kind gestures.
